comment.author: 8683355@N07
comment._content: I added the correct name tag, as the former Governor of New Jersey, President of Princeton, and President of this countries name was spelled wrong.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Wilson and the men to his left are all wearing medals of some sort.  I wonder what the occasion was?

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content:
Senator Ben Tillman of South Carolina

Willard Saulsbury, Jr. (April 17, 1861 - February 20, 1927) was an American lawyer and politician from Wilmington, in New Castle County, Delaware. He was a member of the Democratic Party who served as U.S. Senator from Delaware and President pro tempore of the U.S. Senate.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: These are U. S. Senators of the Democratic Party, visiting Governor Woodrow Wilson of New Jersey at the New Jersey resort of Sea Girt, at the time of Wilson's nomination as the Democratic candidate for President, in the election of 1912.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of the U. S. Senators' "notification of nomination" visit to New Jersey Governor Woodrow Wilson, at Sea Girt, New Jersey, on August 7, 1912.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2368277715/]

And here are Bain/LOC companion photos of a solidarity visit by Democratic Congressmen  to Wilson, after his nomination:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3029430003/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3029431299/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2422676781/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
A Bain/LOC photo of one of the "notification" delegations walking from the train to the New Jersey summertime White House, a seasonal governor's mansion at Sea Girt, New Jersey, to formally notify Wilson of his nomination by the Democratic Convention in Baltimore:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2332833275/]

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Congressman J. Fred C. Talbott (1843-1918), D Maryland, shown as numbered 10. There is another Bain / LOC photo of him at the 1912 Democratic Convention in Baltimore, along with a bio:
